title: Amazing App
text:
I use WhatsApp daily, talking to friends and business associates all over world, and it works flawlessly. I have many friends who actually prefer WhatsApp over cell service and we use it to communicate locally. 

The only folks who don't appreciate WhatsApp are those who haven't downloaded and used it yet. 

Do yourself a favor and install it. Apple and Android users can FaceTime each other and there are no borders any more. 

I absolutely love it and I think you will too.

title: Great app but lacks key functionality
text:
I love WhatsApp, I have friends all around the world and it's great to talk to them on this app. However, there are some key features and functionality missing, and it would be great to see them incorporated:

1. Shake to undo. Or even undo as part of the pop-up menu when you tap the message window. 
2. The ability to translate a message directly as part of the pop-up menu options, instead of copying the message, pasting it, then selecting all, then translating. 
3. Too often when I do the above method of translating, the app just crashes. Luckily the text is still preserved in the window when I re-open, but this shouldn't happen ever, let alone with such frequency. 

These are the major problems. Even with them it's still great to use, and obviously the encryption is stellar. But those are significant flaws.
